newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Nissan to open new car plant in Pakistan.
newsitem.headline: Nissan to open new car plant in Pakistan.

text.p: Pakistan's Ghandhara Nissan Ltd will open a car plant in Pakistan on Wednesday to produce 6,000 Nissan Sunny cars a year in collaboration with Japan's Nissan Motor Co Ltd
"The plant capacity is 6,000 units, single-shift, which can be increased as the demand increases," said a company executive on the eve of the plant's inauguration in Karachi.
The factory can also be used to assemble light commercial vehicles, said the executive, who asked not to be identified.

The project cost an estimated 550 million rupees ($13.7 million), comprising 200 million rupees in equity, 275 million in lease financing and 75 million in financing of locally made machinery, he said.
Illahi Bukhsh Soomro, Speaker of the National Assembly (lower house), will inaugurate the unit on Wednesday.
Ghandhara Nissan Ltd was listed on the Karachi Stock Exchange after it went public in 1993. Its 10-rupee share closed 0.30 rupee down at 10.50 on Tuesday.
Its sister company Ghandhara Nissan Diesel Ltd has manufactured trucks and buses since 1985, with a local content of 50 percent, the executive said.
He said production of Nissan Sunny cars would start with 31 percent of parts locally made, the same proportion as in cars made by competing companies.

Pakistan's three main established car manufacturers -- Pak-Suzuki Motor Co, Honda Atlas Cars and Indus Motors -- produced 38,436 cars in 1995/96 (July-June) compared to 31,239 in 1994/95, an analyst at KASB & Co Ltd brokerage house said.
Pakistan needed 85,000 cars a year and had installed capacity to make 80,000, he added.
